meanings.definition: Entice or persuade someone to do something, typically something they should not do.
meanings.sent1: She was tempted by the delicious smell of freshly baked cookies.
meanings.sent2: He was tempted to skip his homework and play video games instead.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tempted the dog with a dangling toy.
meanings.sent4: The bright lights of the city tempted her to leave her small town behind.
meanings.sent5: The shiny new bike in the store window tempted him to spend all his savings.

meanings.definition: Have an urge or inclination to do something, especially something unwise or wrong.
meanings.sent1: After seeing the tempting display of chocolates, she was tempted to buy them all.
meanings.sent2: He felt tempted to sneak out of the house past his curfew.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was tempted to steal nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The forbidden fruit tempted Eve to take a bite.
meanings.sent5: The thrilling adventure in the book tempted him to stay up all night reading.
